items.title: Andrich vroeg Wirtz niet naar Bayern te gaan: 'Doe ons dit alsjeblieft niet aan'
items.summary: Robert Andrich vindt het verstandig dat Florian Wirtz de interesse van Bayern M√ºnchen liet varen en koos voor een overstap naar Liverpool. 'Ik dacht oprecht dat hij daarheen zou gaan.'

items.title: Heitinga treedt na ontslag bij Ajax toe tot technische staf Spurs
items.summary: John Heitinga keert na zijn ontslag bij Ajax terug in de Premier League. De 42-jarige oud-international gaat bij Tottenham Hotspur aan de slag als assistent van Thomas Frank.

items.title: Robertson in dubio: Schot wil bij Liverpool blijven, maar vooral spelen
items.summary: Andy Robertson is al meer dan acht jaar een betrouwbare kracht bij Liverpool, maar daar komt mogelijk na dit seizoen een einde aan. De Schotse verdediger heeft een aflopend contract en weet nog niet waar zijn toekomst ligt. De kans op speelminuten speelt een grote rol in zijn toekomstige besluit. 'We zullen zien wat er gebeurt.'

items.title: Paqueta could move but be loaned back to West Ham
items.summary: Flamengo are exploring the possibility of loaning Lucas Paqueta back to West Ham as they try to sign the Brazil international this month.

items.title: Feyenoord moet Read voorlopig missen na nieuwe blessure
items.summary: Feyenoord kan voorlopig geen beroep doen op Givairo Read. De talentvolle rechtsback heeft een hamstringblessure opgelopen, waardoor de club hem voor een langere tijd kwijt is. Dat is een flinke domper voor Feyenoord, maar vooral voor Read zelf die net van eenzelfde soort blessure was hersteld.

items.title: Managers' authority is being eroded - Southgate
items.summary: Football managers' authority is being steadily eroded, Sir Gareth Southgate says, but the switch to head coaching still brings a "significant melting pot of problems and pressure".

items.title: Australian Open: Men's and women's draw
items.summary: The full draw for the men's and women's singles tournament for the Australian Open in Melbourne.

items.title: Telstar droomt van De Kuip: 'Zijn met iets unieks bezig'
items.summary: Telstar heeft zich woensdagavond voor het eerst in 24 jaar tijd geplaatst voor de kwartfinale van de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker. Op bezoek bij Almere City won de ploeg van trainer Anthony Correia met 3-1 mede dankzij de treffers van Milan Zonneveld en Patrick Brouwer. VI sprak na de zege met de trainer en de hoofdrolspelers.

items.title: Arbeloa: Madrid Copa exit to 2nd-tier side 'painful'
items.summary: New Real Madrid coach √Ålvaro Arbeloa took responsibility for the team's "painful" 3-2 Copa del Rey defeat to second-tier Albacete on Wednesday, defending his decision to rest a number of senior players.

items.title: Chelsea's Rosenior: Blame me for S√°nchez errors
items.summary: Liam Rosenior has urged Chelsea fans to blame him for Robert S√°nchez's two mistakes which helped Arsenal to a 3-2 victory in Wednesday's Carabao Cup semifinal, first leg at Stamford Bridge.

items.title: FIFA requests for World Cup tickets passes 500M
items.summary: FIFA said Wednesday it has received more than 500 million ticket requests for this year's World Cup.

items.title: Arsenal‚Äôs power statement shows this time they have the muscle for the battle | David Hytner
items.summary: First-leg victory at Stamford Bridge displayed the hallmarks of another vintage Gunners team who refused to be bullied Nobody said it had to be pretty. And for large portions of Arsenal‚Äôs 3-2 win at Chelsea in the Carabao Cup semi-final first-leg on Wednesday, it certainly was not. But for Mikel Arteta and his players, there was a beauty in the physicality, the remorseless levels of aggression. Arsenal won because of what they did without the ball. Yes, there were nice moments from them in possession, most obviously Mart√≠n Zubimendi‚Äôs goal for 3-1. His gliding run from right to left inside the penalty area, especially the fake-to-shoot move that removed the Chelsea defender, Wesley Fofana, from the equation, the composure amid the maelstrom before the execution, was jaw-dropping. Continue reading...

items.title: Replacing Amorim was only the start: Man United have more club-defining decisions ahead

items.title: A no-fuss, loyal, safe option: How Man United chose Carrick as head coach
items.summary: A breakfast meeting set the course for the former Man United star to return as their new head coach for now.

items.title: West Ham will sell Lucas Paquet√° ‚Ä¶ if Flamengo agree to loan him back
items.summary: Londoners have rejected ‚Ç¨35m bid for midfielder Facundo Buonanotte likely to make Leeds move West Ham will sell Lucas Paquet√° this month if the deal includes an agreement for Flamengo to loan the midfielder back for the rest of the season. Flamengo had an opening bid of ‚Ç¨35m (¬£30.3m) rejected for the Brazilian and are prepared to raise their offer to about ‚Ç¨40m. Paquet√° has made clear to West Ham that he wants to return to Brazil and there are signs that the transfer will go ahead. Continue reading...

items.title: Offside or not? Man City, Arsenal and VAR inconsistencies
items.summary: Manchester City had their goal disallowed, while Arsenal's was allowed to stand. But the VAR should not look to be consistent with a previous bad decision.

items.title: Harbaugh agrees to become Giants head coach
items.summary: John Harbaugh has agreed to become the new head coach of the New York Giants, with the former Baltimore Ravens leader finalising a five-year deal with the four-time Super Bowl champions.

items.title: Spurs bring Heitinga on to Frank‚Äôs staff and make Moersen director of football operations
items.summary: Heitinga to have big role with defence, Frank says Moersen to serve months of gardening leave Tottenham have appointed John Heitinga, the former Ajax head coach and assistant to Arne Slot at Liverpool, to Thomas Frank‚Äôs coaching staff. Frank said one of the Dutchman‚Äôs main responsibilities would be to work with the defence. Heitinga‚Äôs arrival was confirmed after Spurs announced that Carlos Raphael Moersen was joining as their first director of football operations. He is coming in from City Football Group, which oversees a stable of clubs that includes Manchester City. Continue reading...

items.title: Robertson keen to stay at Liverpool but 'wants to play football'
items.summary: Liverpool's Andy Robertson on contract talks, a "stressful summer" and why he "wants to play" rather than sit on the bench.

items.title: ‚ÄòA group of people decided to kill me‚Äô: Michel Platini on Fifa, Uefa and the fight to clear his name
items.summary: Former Uefa president ‚Äì caught between moving on and settling scores ‚Äì talks candidly about his downfall, Infantino and the snakepit of the game‚Äôs governance ‚ÄúThere are millions and millions of romantics in football,‚Äù Michel Platini says. He has been asked whether, after a decade frozen out of the game, its lustre has vanished for him. ‚ÄúMillions who share the ideas that I have. But in the end, it‚Äôs big business.‚Äù It is an industry whose peaks Platini scaled before, in one of football‚Äôs biggest falls from grace, it spat him out. He maintains he would have become Fifa president if he had not been banned from football over an alleged unlawful payment made to him in 2011, when he was running Uefa, by Sepp Blatter. The scandal led to a criminal case but both men were acquitted for a second time, definitively so, by a Swiss appeals court last year. Nothing hangs over Platini any more, bar a conviction that he was cheated. Continue reading...
